website_summaries.verdict: A powerful machine with plenty of outlets. PowerSmart Series Technology makes it surprisingly quiet.
pros: Automatic voltage regulation irons out fluctuations in power supply
Fuel gauge lets you easily see when gas is running low
Engine speed reduces noise, fuel consumption, and carbon emissions
cons: Some complaints about it being noisy

customer_reviews.title: Great been using it since Hurricane Maria In PR !
customer_reviews.text: This little machine is been running solid since November. It runs 14 hours a day from 8am to 3pm and 8pm to 3am. I use less than 6 dollars a day ! My oil Mobile 1 Synthetic 10w 30 every 4 days. Its January and still going strong love this thing .... EDIT : It's February 3 and electricity was back yesterday finally and the Inverter made it and still in good shape ! I'm cleaning it and saving it for future need. Highly recomend !!!
customer_reviews.author: Ramon

customer_reviews.title: Started one time. Took into authorized reapir shop where ...
customer_reviews.text: Started one time. Took into authorized reapir shop where a problem was found requiring major work because of faulty workmanship from Briggs and Stratton. Oil weep hole on crankshaft is pluge causing the cylinder to become scored. Repair shop has beed trying to contact Briggs but they will not return calls. So now I have to fight to either get a replacement genarator or my money back. Wife says I should of bought a Honda instead of trying to savce some money!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Elkins

customer_reviews.title: Do your research!!
customer_reviews.text: There’s a much better option, same brand , more powerful and cheaper. Briggs & Stratton 30675 Q6500 Inverter Generator - 6500 Starting Watts QuietPower Series Portable Generator for Home Backup
customer_reviews.author: Jorge

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: This generator was purchased to replace a IU2000 Honda. It has now been used 2 times for about 12hrs straight each time to power a travel trailer. It seems to work as advertised. My Honda worked well for 2 years, but had carb, then fuel pump failure no doubt due to 87 octane/ethanol blend being used at some point. For half the price, this seems to be a comparable generator. As with all small engine devices, find a source for non-ethanol fuel. It has proven to be cancer to everything it's run in.
customer_reviews.author: RehabGuy

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Too loud! They said the was quieter than other generators. Don't believe it, you cannot talk over this.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy K.

customer_reviews.title: We recently purchased a Honda generator at work and liked its quality but not the price so after researching ...
customer_reviews.text: We recently purchased a Honda generator at work and liked its quality but not the price so after researching I discovered this Briggs and purchased one for myself. This unit is all but identical to the Honda and over three hundred dollars cheaper. So far I am delighted.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Silvagni

customer_reviews.title: Great product Briggs
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this generator after looking at many options and almost buying the Honda 3000i. The unit started first pull out of the box, runs as quiet as anything I've compared it to, and functions perfectly. Thoroughly impressed with this generator, especially at the price comparison to the Honda. Great product Briggs. Well done.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Lebrun

customer_reviews.title: I already own the 2000 watt generator which has been good so far
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for the Briggs and Stratton P3000. I already own the 2000 watt generator which has been good so far. I thought I'd buy the P3000 to run my RV 13,500 BTU Air Conditioner. Unit ran well and provided ample power. My first camping trip went off without a hitch. My second trip out is when things went wrong. The pull cord was locked up solid. At first I believe it must be vapor locked. I pulled the plug and still was unable to crank the unit. Sent back to Amazon for a refund. I guess I will look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Walter B Bingham

customer_reviews.title: Used it for Hurricane Irma for about 28 hours in ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it for Hurricane Irma for about 28 hours in Jacksonville Florida. No issues, started every time on the first pull. I ran a full size fridge, 42" tv, lamp and a tower fan.
customer_reviews.author: Penny

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: One thing I will say to everyone who marked it below 5 stars, production is t perfect making 1000’s = some will have defaults. With that out of the way. Followed all instructions and everything ran fine. Power was out 17 hours and I power small ac unit, the fridge and a few non essentials. Only use half a gal of gas!!!!!! I’m in the military and had to leave my wife to make sure the base stayed functional. I felt confident leaving her in good hands. Thank you Briggs and thank you order processing guy at Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: donald blanton

customer_reviews.title: I vacuumed my vehicle with a shop-vac running off this generator and ran a circular saw on it as well and it handled the loads j
customer_reviews.text: Put gas/oil in, read manual, and started on the first pull of the pull-cord. I vacuumed my vehicle with a shop-vac running off this generator and ran a circular saw on it as well and it handled the loads just fine. I am using this as an emergency generator so do not expect to use often but so far I am very please with the light-weight, portability, and early reliability. I hope this works for years to come as needed. It was also important to me that I could charge small electronics of f of this in the event of a power outage such as cell phones.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda J.

customer_reviews.title: First Impressions - Jan 2020
customer_reviews.text: Well-packed. Feels heavier than weight suggests. Greatest disappointment? Well, my unit was manufactured more than two years ago ... in 2017; talk about the "slow boat from China"! Why is that a concern? Well, [1] the engine's been sitting idle for years; [2] hopefully, in those 2+ years, B&S should have made improvement [maybe the manual?] and I didn't get them. Make sure you read all four manuals cover-to-cover ... you'll find important stuff in one that you don't find in another [like turn off the QPT switch before trying to start ... but I already thought that since I have owned a Generac i2000].
customer_reviews.author: Blackbeered

customer_reviews.title: It did the job.
customer_reviews.text: I finally got to use this during the recent winter storms in the Northeast. I used it with a small electric heater to keep one room of my house warm while the power was out. I only needed it for a few hours. Also serve as backup power for my sump pump. It was easy to start even after sitting outside for over a month. Relatively quiet when operating. Only down side was trying to figure out how much fuel was left, but other than that it did the job !
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: HERE IS A TIP!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great 2200 generator. 1) put oil in run for 30 minutes on smart load. 2) turn off smart load and run for 30 minutes. 3) dump & change oil. They make this very simple for you without making a mess. 4) I live in south Florida so I used Royal Purple 10w40 Synthetic with Synerlec. If you follow these steps This little engine that could will run forever with no engine wear because of the Synerlec additive in the Royal Purple. It is a lil costly but worth every penny. (amazon link
customer_reviews.author: chauncey2

customer_reviews.title: A complete piece of JUNK.
customer_reviews.text: This thing died after less than three hours use only running one sump pump. it is a useless door-stop now. wont start wont do anything, trouble shooting guide was useless, it died AND WILL NOT RESTART. I WANT A REFUND!
customer_reviews.author: D. Bagwell

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had zero problems with this generator, starts beautifully and powers my RV air conditioner and microwave flawlessly. I do wish it had a little more ground clearance, it is a little cumbersome to move around on uneven forest ground. I bought it in June 2019 and used it through the labor day weekend, on weekends and several times for full week vacations, and it has performed perfectly. I went through the break-in procedure at home before my first trip and changed the oil as recommended and in the roughly 130 hours of operation since have not had to add additional oil. Overall very pleased with this generator.
customer_reviews.author: WYOAmazon guy

customer_reviews.title: Bought two at once, one cranks on first or ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought two at once, one cranks on first or second try. One takes a few extra pulls and sometimes a waiting period between attempts to crank. Followed instructions, exactly. Much louder than Honda and Yamaha inverter generators.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Won't Run an RV A/C
customer_reviews.text: I liked this generator's style and quality, but it wouldn't run my RV 13,500 BTU A/C unit. This was disappointing as it comes with an RV plug adaptor giving the impression it would work. I returned the generator to find one that would work for a similar price range.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan C.

customer_reviews.title: Pull start cord is Fragile
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars for customer service, returns & shipping. Overall product is awesome! Kept up with my RV Yet twice pull start cord Tore Off handle! oh hell NO!! Off the grid keep in mind! Returned it. Received a new replacement promptly! Then it happened again. So Yeah! Not keeping it. Need one with a better quality grip. Or maybe modify it somehow Prior to Being in some bush! with kids no wifi no Bluetooth beats no microwave wtf! Need that cord though!! Briggs & Stratton MODIFY your CORDS & HANDLES! Thanks
customer_reviews.author: PEARSON

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy be this.  Not good and can't return
customer_reviews.text: This generator is not worth your time. Takes forever to start and does not power up the things it should be. Totally not happy with this product and I am not able to return it. I have to go through the warranty. I DON'T LIKE THIS PRODUCT but forced to keep it.
customer_reviews.author: Kmm1177

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, just add oil and gas
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to run in parallel to power my RV trailer. Arrived in two days. Easy setup, just add oil and gas. Both units fired up on the first pull and ran smoothly and quietly. I warmed them up a little while, then connected them to my RV using the parallel kit. They powered all the normal things I would run at the same time, including the A/C. When the A/C was running, these ran at higher rpm's, but without hesitation or sputtering. I opted for two smaller, quieter units rather than one larger and louder. I'm pleased with my choice. This is a great setup for anyone using them to power an RV.
customer_reviews.author: mx219

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this product to anyone looking for a nice generator ...
customer_reviews.text: Quiet little generate that we can use for our travel trailer when we go camping. We're already thinking about buying a second one to bridge together so that we can run our air conditioning in the travel trailer as well. I would recommend this product to anyone looking for a nice generator that's quiet without the price that Honda generators have.
customer_reviews.author: D. S. Hicks

customer_reviews.title: When it’s good it’s good, but when it’s bad beware!!
customer_reviews.text: We got a dud. Electrical problem verified by numerous service shops when we described what problems we were having. Cannot get anyone local to work on issue and Briggs will not take a return, stated it has to be at a warranty dealer before they can do anything. Having to drive an hour away. Nothing but a run around from Briggs & Stratton, they have been very little help. A wheel has broken already also, wheeling in the truck bed to the tailgate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am extremely pleased.
customer_reviews.text: This generator is quiet and has surpassed my expectations!! I am new to the generator world. I did extensive research before I decided what I wanted. I have a 2015 Passport 24' travel trailer. This generator powered the AC all day long, was quiet, and used very little fuel. I am extremely pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Price and size/ power output
customer_reviews.text: The size and power is great. The price for an American machine is also great value. I had some initial problem with the when I gassed It the second time, it would not run on load. This was annoying as we were at campground without electricity. When I returned home I took it to a Briggs &Stratton agent. Long story short, apparently these small engines tuning on fuel that is mixed with ethanol tend to absorb water in the carburetor so it is advisable to add a fuel treatment stabilizer to your fuel every time you fill up. I’m surprised the manufacturer don’t suggest this in there manual.
customer_reviews.author: Luvreading

customer_reviews.title: Shipped with Totally Dead Battery
customer_reviews.text: Shipped with a Chinese motorcycle battery that was dead and beyond charging. I had to buy a replacement battery for $88 to make the electric start and dials on the generator work properly. When I talked with a Briggs & Stratton representative on the phone he denied that Briggs & Stratton even sells on Amazon and that the product comes with a battery. Totally dissatisfied with the service and response I received from Briggs & Stratton and therefore I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: William Gavin Scott

customer_reviews.title: Briggs & Stratton P3000
customer_reviews.text: Received quickly. Well packaged. Funnel was not cracked as others had stated. Directions are straight forward. I oiled it up and after 7 pulls it started. It would have started sooner if I had the eco mode off as the directions stated. I let it run for a while and then ran it on a load (electric heater) for 30 minutes. We bought this for our camper. Once I get it tested running our 13.5 K AC unit I will update this review. Yes I know this is at the upper range for this generator. If the AC is on it will be the item powered by the generator.
customer_reviews.author: Chappy 133

customer_reviews.title: Quite and Portable, but does not surge well
customer_reviews.text: This generator ran quietly,but was not able to handle the surge levels advertised, so it could not run my RV AC, even with that being the only load on the generator.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Wise

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't turn on
customer_reviews.text: We literally opened it up and it won't start. My husband has been on the phone with service for a while now. Keeps flashing an overload sign but nothing is plugged in to overload it.
customer_reviews.author: Living The Dream

customer_reviews.title: Generators relief our life's
customer_reviews.text: I bought this generator because we are with no electric power in PR. I can connect my fridge, freezer, tv, and a fan from 10:00pm to 6:00am and works great. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: LuzAcevedo

customer_reviews.title: P3000 is a nice little generator...when everything works!
customer_reviews.text: Straight out of the box brand new my P3000 unit had a faulty QPT function, in essence the 'inverter' (that makes these units so much more expensive) didn't work and I just had a standard, loud generator. Amazon gave me a partial refund which was nice and took some sting out of the price and since everything else works ok I'm going to keep it for hurricane-level blackouts where I wouldn't be using QPT anyway so just beware and make sure everything works on yours!
customer_reviews.author: Rick Deckard

customer_reviews.title: The best small generator in the market
customer_reviews.text: I don't remember what I paid for this unit but it's priceless. I research for 6 months, Honda, Yamaha you name it, before I took off in my truck camper with it. I still can't believe it! I run my Ac all night long, last night it ran for 10:45hrs and that's 3years 2months ago I bought it. The price has dropped($200 less) and it's a no brainer. Starts on one pull lol near 500hrs. I am a mechanic and I just laugh from Amazement like right now.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: So I highly recommend the B&S generators and was great to save a ...
customer_reviews.text: we had 2 honda generators stolen from us and needed to replace for using in our rv. we went with 2 briggs & stratton and they are very comparable to the honda's with being less expensive. I was concerned about the noise if they would be higher then the hondas, but I couldn't tell any difference between the 2 brands. So I highly recommend the B&S generators and was great to save a few hundred dollars as well, so it was a win win.
customer_reviews.author: holly2u2

customer_reviews.title: Life saver for Hurricane Irma power outage
customer_reviews.text: These things are a lifesaver for this extended and still in progress power outage. I am in an airconditioned cooled room right now with working internet thanks to it. It has been running extended duty for hours in two homes ( two units shipped right before the hurricane) they are super reliable and super easy one pull start. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: NCX100000

customer_reviews.title: Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Great generator, I have been using them none stop since Hurricane Maria in Puerto Rico, I purchased two of them and my sole recommendation is keep up with the oil change and after the first 100 hours go with the SAE Synthetic 5W30 oil. The gen is quite and fuel efficient. No regrets for choosing this machine over the over priced Honda competitor.
customer_reviews.author: Salsa NYC

customer_reviews.title: Very nice generator
customer_reviews.text: While I was hoping for something a bit quieter under full load, I am pleased with the generator. I do like the eco mode when not using much power and it is extremely quiet. Under full load, however, it isn't much quieter than my other generator which is much older and larger. I have had a couple of instances where it has just shut down for no reason that I can determine. Usually, that happens when a heavy load is first turned on. I do like the weight since I am older and it is easy to load into my truck by myself. Overall, I am pleased
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Starts instantly. Easy to use. Works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: We've used the Briggs and Stratton generator twice during two seperate extended power outages. I'm glad I bought this unit. It's not for running a large Fridge! Works perfectly for just about everything you need: to stay warm with a small heater, make a batch of coffee with your coffee maker, charge up electronics, use your TV, and light up your house. Just pay attention to the total wattage. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: r and a

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Has great built in features, Starts easily and is quiet. I was between this and the Honda , I have not owned the Honda but for the added features you get with this and the savings over the Honda I am very pleased with the purchase so far. I have not powered my RV with it yet but have ran random tools around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It did it all!!!
customer_reviews.text: We had computers, AC ,Movie Projector,etc. It ran everything on low power mode all day and night, with very little fuel. It could be a little more quiet,but otherwise A+
customer_reviews.author: Brian KTM

customer_reviews.title: Defective Out Of The Box
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this new generator to take on a trip, right out of the box after following all the instructions I go to start the unit and the pull cord detaches from the Handle and is now inside the unit. Unusable and a complete waste of money. if this is quality, you will be disappointed. Come on right out of the box and I can't even get the stupid thing running....... HORRIBLE
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Breecher

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to start
customer_reviews.text: I only run this thing a couple times a year, so I expect it to start a little slow. Slow? Try like 200 pulls on the starter cord and nothing. Full choke, half choke, using starting ether, nothing. My lawn mower starts in the spring with last fall's gas after 3 or 4 pulls. This thing is just not worth the trouble. Heaven help me if I really needed it in an emergency. Wish I hadn't bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Red State

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, quiet. Briggs and Stratton, I mean really -  what else needs be said?
customer_reviews.text: Boy oh boy - does the job! Just what it's intended for! Wish I could've gotten a 220V one from the Australian domestic market - since my country is 220V. But oh boy that proved difficult lol. All the same, this thing will give you the 8 hours on 25%~30% Load. Trust me. I've gotten 9, and every time I got more than 8. Just make sure you turn on the QPT switch, or else in 3 hours or less it will drink that 1 gallon tank up trust me ahaha. But as far as the reliability and noise level. It's great! Got it after my Island Nation was ravaged by Hurricane Maria.
customer_reviews.author: Fabien Charles

customer_reviews.title: It runs great but all reviews I read before purchase said it ...
customer_reviews.text: It runs great but all reviews I read before purchase said it is as quiet as a Honda, that is absolutely not the case. It is quite loud!
customer_reviews.author: Colie

customer_reviews.title: love this
customer_reviews.text: we got a great price on this item and decided to take a chance on it we have only used it once and love it we could stand right beside it and talk and didnot have to shout there were other campers there with other generators and they were louder we love the handle on top as we can both get on both sides and carry it--and yes one person could carry it easily but my husband had surgery and is on a weight limit we look forward to using this all summer
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to bridge with a second unit if necessary.
customer_reviews.text: Briggs and Stratton 30545 P3000 portable inverter generator has all the power and necessary pluses that you want in a portable generator. Easy pull start, easy to read display, telescoping handle and wheels for easy maneuverability. All the power that you will need to keep things running smoothly in the event of power outages or camping or tailgating.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin Solomon

customer_reviews.title: This product was how we survived after Hurricane Irma
customer_reviews.text: This product saved us during hurricane Irma. It ran for 6 days straight without any issue. It was able to run our fridge, tv, ceiling fan, and window AC unit. Without it we would have been completely miserable. I would buy this again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsey Owens

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: My new generator arrived quickly, unpacked it, no probs. poured the oil in it,through the handy funnel, then gas......Oh my, started on first easy pull......and very quiet....let it run for about 5 min or so. Plugged in my porter cable pancake compressor.....worked great.....I purchased this compressor for construction and r.v. Looking forward to using it more.....highly recommend....
customer_reviews.author: Scott Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Very compact unit with and excellent design. Very easy to move around with built ...
customer_reviews.text: Very compact unit with and excellent design. Very easy to move around with built in handle. This unit started right up right out of the box with a few pulls of the starter rope. I tested the unit on my 15000 BTU RV air conditioner. The air conditioner started right up and the generator ran at 60% of it electrical capacity. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Return shipping costly
customer_reviews.text: Hello. I for some reason dont feel that hving to pay for return shipping on an item that is defective is good buisness practice. I will return the item for what should be a full refund but also I should get a refund on the return shipping. It is not my fault that the item is defective, so why the having to pay for return ship?
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: typical briggs and stratton..... started ...
customer_reviews.text: typical briggs and stratton.....started right up and ran perfectly, very quite even under load you can have a normal conversation next to it without shouting. Update 5-23-20, this unit quit starting up after 2 years 2 months, problem was just the spark plug needed to be replaced and it is easy to get to, contrary to my previous update which i hope gets deleted, after a new plug it started first pull. You can't beat a Briggs & Stratton.....period.
customer_reviews.author: oneshott5000

customer_reviews.title: Great for emergency and camping!
customer_reviews.text: This generator is great. Got it just in time before a storm knocked out the power. Powered a could stand up freezers and the TV no problem. I also got the 2000 watt at the same time. I loaned it to the neighbor so they could keep there new born puppies warm.
customer_reviews.author: Nolan Rice

customer_reviews.title: revised: Garbage after a year
customer_reviews.text: Update: Bought 2 to run in parallel. one stopped working a 6 months ago, and the other wont start today (unexpected power outage). No, i dont run ethanol in them... initially i gave these generators a good rating, but as of today. i have 2 giant paper weights. 01/11/2019 After 4 hours trying to get my generators running, only one would run. ran it for an hour before the storm hit and it quit right before the storm. These are absolute garbage. I will NEVER purchase a Briggs & Stratton product ever again.
customer_reviews.author: JonC from TN

customer_reviews.title: does not start
customer_reviews.text: bought as it is easier for me to lift. I have used it twice since purchase. I did start it 2 months ago but now it wont start again. I have had it to a local small engine. He sprayed either into it and it started. Once I got it home it wont start again. I use only ethanol free gas and it kept inside. I now have a paper weight . Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: tm

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Performs as advertised. I just got this unit as a backup for our house big 11Kw generator here in Puerto Rico. After hurricane Maria, sometimes is difficult to get LP gas delivered to our house's 500lbs tank. We are using the P2200 to maintain the fridge running. It runs the fridge and many fans/lights you connect to it with little noise and small gas consumption at much less cost than a Honda model.
customer_reviews.author: J. P. Rochet

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, Reliable and easy to carry
customer_reviews.text: Put it to work with a 10 day camping trip. No problem powering Laptops, Fans and most important the wife brought the Latte maker. Running multiple box fans on high and charging 4 phones it would run 9pm to 7am no problem. It generally ran out of gas after about 10 hours constant use. It's pretty quiet under normal load - it was pretty loud running the Latte maker but would go back to quiet after the heat cycle. It's a little heavy but the H handle is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Kenney J.  Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Everything ran smoother
customer_reviews.text: Thought if I added this inverter to my other P3000 generator I could run both air conditioners in my 5th wheel. I was wrong. The 1st generator ran 1 perfectly adding the 2nd didn't let me run both together. But everything else ran smoother and wasn't running as loud on just 1.
customer_reviews.author: Roger D. Hermes

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent!
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with this purchase, not only was the price great but I put the oil in filled with gas and the first pull it was running. It runs very quiet and very smooth. Looks like it is built very well.
customer_reviews.author: Lone Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Good quality generator
customer_reviews.text: Ran a 10,000 BTU window AC Unit, large deep freezer and an array of lights and chargers during Irma. Easy to use and was quiet enough not to bother neighbors.
customer_reviews.author: USA1

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great quality item. We have had no issues and have used it a handful of times for camping.
customer_reviews.author: shannon

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: The first generator I received, The pull rope worked three times then would not retract / recoil rope. Called AMAZON was forwarded to Briggs and Stratton. They informed me to take it to local shop who had a two week backlog. Needing A generator ASP I called AMAZON again They shipped another one , followed all instructions when tried to start it the low oil sensor was bad sow unit would not start ( yes I put the recommended oil amount that was shipped with the unit into engine.) Think there may be a quality control issue.
customer_reviews.author: going to buy a different brand

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Louder than we expected it to be but not as loud as many others. Funnel that came with it was broken when received. Easy start and light weight exactly what we needed
customer_reviews.author: Karen S

customer_reviews.title: I'm a very satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this portable generator for 3 months everyday in Haiti and I haven't had any issues with it, although I don't put a lot of things on it, just lights, a couple of fans and a TV. So far I'm satisfied with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy to use and provides the power needed
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, quiet, easy to use and provides the power needed.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Great Small Generator
customer_reviews.text: Generator was easy to set up and get running, best practices were followed and hope that it will be reliable in the future when it is needed. Power production seems to be on point.
customer_reviews.author: Cryph

customer_reviews.title: great power for the money
customer_reviews.text: I grew up Briggs & Stratton products, a trusted name. First pull it started right up. Very quiet and smooth running, great power for the money.
customer_reviews.author: ralph

customer_reviews.title: Generator P4500
customer_reviews.text: Unit came in today, After set-up I ran it for 30 min's with no load. Break-in. Hook the RV to it and ran A/C unit and other items in the RV for 1 hour under a load. I was impressed with this unit...
customer_reviews.author: Bob Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Will not run 13500 BTU AC
customer_reviews.text: Bought this basing my info off the internet with people saying a 13500 btu RV ac unit needs around 2700 starting watts. At 3000, this came close but figured it would work.......it does not. I am at an elevation of 5800 ft above sea level and tried to run ac and no luck. Trying to return so I can link their 2200 versions together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Generator
customer_reviews.text: Bought too power my 5th wheel rv. Will run one a/c, but not both. It does everything else very nicely. Noise level is very good, and fuel economy good, I would recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Tipton

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery! This product was much needed after the hurricanes that took place in 2017. Three years later and the generator still works great.
customer_reviews.author: Farrah

customer_reviews.title: This is my second P2200
customer_reviews.text: This is my second P2200. I bought the first one 3 years ago. It has been flawless. I put oil and fresh gas in my New P2200 and ran it for an hour without issue. The first one has been very good to me. Sold it to my kid. Thats why I purchased a second one. Do yourself a favor. Run Non-Ethanol gas in it and change the oil once a season and it will serve you well.
customer_reviews.author: Meatwagon

customer_reviews.title: Horrible business to deal with...
customer_reviews.text: Bought one and within 3hrs of use, the carburator had gotten stuck and caused the generator to fail. Briggs and Stratton will not honor any warranty involving the fuel system. So when their self adjusting carburetor blows up your inverter, best of luck getting B&S to hell you. Biggest waste of money and scam that I've ever dealt with.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Just received
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in good shape, packaged well. We oiled it up and fueled it and ran it with a 1500 watt electric heater for load. It ran well and did everything that is expected. Nice unit so far. Hope I never really need to use it. B
customer_reviews.author: Brett F. Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Poor support after the sale. Can't be relied apon.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one last spring. Since then it has run a total of 2 hours over that time. Sometimes it starts, most of the time it doesn't. If I can get it to run it pulsates up and down. Would not run a microwave popping popcorn in my RV without tripping the overload switch. I think I got a lemon. Calling the manufacture is a joke. No product knowledge. They don't even know who repairs their generators in town. One of the recommended places to take it 'In Reno Nevada' turned out to actually be in South Africa. Save your money on this one.
customer_reviews.author: J. Patera

customer_reviews.title: It was awesome! An absolute workhorse that fit my needs
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this just before hurricane Irma hit my house. This is my first portable generator and I purchased it based on several online reviews. Put in in service after we lost power during the storm. It was awesome! An absolute workhorse that fit my needs. Fairly quiet it ran for over 8 hours with just the first fill up. Gave it five stars since I don't have one bad thing to say.
customer_reviews.author: FDsnare

customer_reviews.title: gassed it up and it started easy. Tried some appliances and seems to work well
customer_reviews.text: Added the oil that was included, gassed it up and it started easy. Tried some appliances and seems to work well. Low noise.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Small Emergency Generator
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in anticipation of a power outage from Hurricane Irma, which did happen. It ran great and kept my refrigerator running, along with a small over the air TV and a couple of lamps and my cell pjhone charger. I had to rig up a protective covering since, of course, it was pouring rain, so if you're thinking about getting this for a storm outage, you might give that some thought. My only quibble, and it's minor, is that I wish it had some kind of fuel gauge. Overall, first rate! Easy to set up, easy to start, easy to refuel, even in the pouring rain.
customer_reviews.author: JM Brandt

customer_reviews.title: Fierce Competitor in this market.
customer_reviews.text: The Cadillac of all Generators. I am sorry Honda, but for this price and the quietness you have a fierce competitor. Strongly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Rodolfo carra

customer_reviews.title: Works great despite being cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Came in with a cheap broken plastic wheel. Handle is flimsy not overly impressed with the quality
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: It runs every thing on my boat. Great for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: albert bloch

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box I am very impressed. This comes with a new bottle of oil, and a battery charger/smoke plug connect also. Very simple Instructions to get it started up after adding oil and gas and very quiet for a generator/inverter. Haven’t used it yet for my RV but looking forward to it. Looks like a great one!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon B.

customer_reviews.title: This generator ran my travel trailer ac with no issues ...
customer_reviews.text: This generator ran my travel trailer ac with no issues at all. It is quieter than other generators that I'm used to, but still too loud for a campsite.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Iit is not often that things work out better than you expect but this did. My son and I took it out of box and prepped it with oil and gas and in less than 15 minutes most of which was reading had it running. Was quiet and most importantly ran large freezer storing lot of our food.
customer_reviews.author: Zxcvb

customer_reviews.title: excellent generator it started right up nice and easy was ...
customer_reviews.text: excellent generator it started right up nice and easy was very quiet I love it gonna be great for camping
customer_reviews.author: david a roest

customer_reviews.title: starts up every time
customer_reviews.text: works great. I have not tested the max output but. starts and runs every time and powers everything I need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quite and powerful
customer_reviews.text: Awesome generator. Quite and powerful and over kill for my TT. With EVERYTHING on possible and having a 15000btu a/c it runs at 75%!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Oswalt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome generator
customer_reviews.text: I have a 12 year old briggs and Stratton lawn mower, every spring time it fires right up and mows the lawn every year. So when I saw this generator I couldn't pass it up. It runs everything on my 5th wheel. nice and quiet for its size.
customer_reviews.author: Nanette Larsen

customer_reviews.title: ... more expensive than I wanted to spend but worked great and really quiet
customer_reviews.text: Little more expensive than I wanted to spend but worked great and really quiet. Ran 7-9hrs powering a fridge and garage freezer after the hurricane.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Quiet
customer_reviews.text: I connect two in parallel to power the air conditioning in my camper. Works great. Quiet
customer_reviews.author: Orv Hoger

customer_reviews.title: Great generator at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Briggs and Stratton is a great product. Used it to run our electricity and watch movies on our t.v. with no problems all night in our pop up trailer it was so quite we left it running all night on a full tank.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is for the p2200. Very impressed with the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is for the p2200. Very impressed with the quality. Started on the second pull after adding gas and oil. My friend has the Honda 2000, ran them side by side and they very similar sounding.
customer_reviews.author: Wade1

customer_reviews.title: Excellent setup for a boat
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my honda eu2000i with this for the added watts. So far I'm very happy, runs as quietly as the Honda when under normal and low load situations. At high load it might be a bit louder but we are splitting hairs on the dB levels. The fuel tank is larger but that is offset by the larger load capacity. Running a 12k BTU window shaker, battery charger and several fans I can get 7 hours out of a full tank. I can run two of these AC units simultaneously but it will occasionally shut down due to overload if both units start up together.
customer_reviews.author: s

customer_reviews.title: looks nice. Haven't used it yet
customer_reviews.text: We go hunting in Oct. We haven't been camping since this purchase. But it sounds quiet
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Great little generator
customer_reviews.text: Started with one pull. I ran it for about 4 hours to break it in at varying loads. About 12 hours on it now. Meets my needs. Excellent buy..
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Possien

customer_reviews.title: These things suck Run about half the time and when you really ...
customer_reviews.text: These things suck Run about half the time and when you really need them because you have no power hook up for your camper they will not run in parallel. I bought 2 for them. Both have been in the shop 2 times each and still can not get them to run right. Will take them in to the shop again this week let see what happens .
customer_reviews.author: Jonthan C.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: Pulled this out of the box, fueled it up and would not start. I've had 3 mechanics look over this and they cannot figure out what is wrong. Amazon will not allow a return.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler T

customer_reviews.title: like the micro wave and one small at the same ...
customer_reviews.text: Starts on the second pull when cold., but reliable. It runs one large appliance, like the micro wave and one small at the same time. It should work fine for our hunting trip
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy I. Worley

customer_reviews.title: Works like a generator, not as quiet as Honda.
customer_reviews.text: Works like a generator should, definitely louder than the comparable Honda model. Seems to be a problem with the case that surrounds the fuel tank, creates vibrations that increase noise levels dramatically. I have been adding dynamat to decrease the vibrations and have had some success.
customer_reviews.author: William Saghy

customer_reviews.title: ... for Hurricane Irma coming to Florida and it worked great up until last night
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item last week for Hurricane Irma coming to Florida and it worked great up until last night. All of a sudden it shut down and wouldn't restart. I checked the oil, which was fine and then checked the spark plug and didn't get any spark. I went and replaced the plug and still no spark. I'm waiting on hold with Briggs and Stratton to see what I have to do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great unit
customer_reviews.text: Fires up on first pull every time. Very quiet compared to other ones I’ve used before. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: FortWorthLCL

customer_reviews.title: Won’t run. Customer care at Briggs and Stratton says defective
customer_reviews.text: Ready to leave on vacation. Fueled and oil. Won’t stay running. Company says defective but no time to send back. Sending me possibly 60 miles away to get worked on if I can get in. You would think for almost $900 it would work coming out of the box. First time ever disappointed with Amazon. Of course didn’t keep box. Already had generator in back of rv
customer_reviews.author: michael smail

product_meta.title: Briggs & Stratton P3000 Power Smart Series Inverter Generator with LCD Display and Quiet Power Technology, 3000 Starting Watts 2600 Running Watts, RV Ready
product_meta.description: Style:3000-WattBriggs & Stratton P3000 Power Smart Series Inverter Generator with LCD Display and Quiet Power Technology, 3000 Starting Watts 2600 Running Watts, RV Ready.
feature_bullets: Run time: Up to 10 at 1/4 Load
Clean and instant power to keep appliances and other important electronics running during a power outage, 30545s engine speed reduces noise, fuel consumption and emissions
Quieter than a traditional camping generator with enough power to start a standard RV air conditioner
1.5 gallon fuel tank for an impressive 10 hours of continuous operation at 25 percent load on a full tank. Engine Displacement 171 (cc)
(4) household outlets (1) 12 volt 30 amp locking outlet with RV adaptor DC charging outlet and a USB port
Can not be shipped to the state of California

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars568 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
